entry.title: Username and Password - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
What is my username and password?

Formerly known as a Boost ID, your Boost username and password are used to access and manage your Boost service.

Your username is the email address you used to activate your Boost service with us. It enables you to securely access and manage specific features in the app, such as:

- Set up and manage auto recharge
- Save and manage your credit / debit card details
- Manage multiple services
- View your usage history
- View your recharge history

How to recover username in the My Boost Mobile app:

1. Open the My Boost Mobile app and tap the black "Sign in" button at the bottom of the screen.
2. Tap "Recover username" under the username text field.
3. Choose how you want to recover the username by selecting email address or Boost mobile number.
4. Tap the black "Let's get started" button.
5. Now enter your email address.
6. You should receive an email from us shortly with you username. If you can't find it in your inbox, please check your junk mail.
7. Tap the sign in button.

How do I reset my password?

When prompted, enter your username in the box provided, and click Send.

An email will be sent with a link to reset your password. Simply click on the link and follow the prompts.

Now you're good to go! You can sign into the My Boost Mobile app and access the additional features.

entry.title: Change account ownership - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to change your account ownership

To transfer your account to another person, or to update account details, please contact us. You can call 1800 100 933 or Message Us on our help page.

entry.title: Extend your ring time - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to extend your ring time

To extend your phone's ring time, follow these simple steps:

  1. On your Boost mobile dial **61*101**(number of seconds: 15, 20, 25 or 30)#
  2. Press the Call/Send button
For example, to extend your ring time to 30 seconds, you would dial **61*101**30#

entry.title: Manage your service - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to manage your service

The easiest way to manage your service is in the My Boost Mobile app and online.

With the My Boost Mobile app you can recharge, set up auto recharge, check you balance, see your usage & recharge history, get help and more. 

My Boost Mobile is available for iOS and Android and is for customers on the Boost Mobile Prepaid Plan. 

You can also recharge on our website by signing in or using our online recharge option.

entry.title: Spam, prank or unwanted calls - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to stop spam, prank or unwanted calls

If you are experiencing nuisance calls or messages, please contact us so we can further investigate it with you. You can either call us on 1800 100 933 or Message us by clicking "Message Us" on our Help page 

If you are getting telemarking calls you can sign up for the Do Not Call register. You can also report unwanted calls to the Australian Communications & Media Authority here.

entry.title: Recharge History - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How do I see my recharge history?

 You can see your recharge history in the My Boost Mobile app.


Simply open the My Boost Mobile app and sign in with your username and password. Once logged in, tap on your phone number and scroll to the bottom of your balance summary screen. There you will see "Recharge History" - tap this and you'll be able to see your recharge history including when you recharged, how much you recharged, and your payment method. 

Where available you'll also be able to download a Receipt and Tax Invoice.

If you need more information, please message us by clicking the 'Message Us' button on our Help page.

entry.title: Check for service disruptions - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How to check for outages or service disruptions

If you are unable to use your Boost Mobile to send SMS, make calls or get online, it may be due to a disruption to Boost Mobile services. These issues can range from hardware faults to outages or scheduled maintenance on the Telstra Mobile Network infrastructure.

Click here to check if there is an outage or service disruption in your area. 

On this page you'll find updates on issues affecting our services across the country and where possible, provide an estimate restoration time so you know how long it will be until services are back up and running. 

If there are no known issues in your area, please contact us. The easiest way to get in touch is to Message us from our Help page.

entry.title: Does you number expire - Help and Support - Boost Mobile
entry.content:
How long before my number expires?

Your number will expire if you do not recharge your service for 6 months.

entry.title: Request A Refund
entry.content:
How do I request a refund?

If you made a purchase on the Boost website

If you believe you’ve been incorrectly charged and would like a refund, please Message us (7am-11pm AEST, 7 days)

If you made a purchase in a retailer

Please return the product with receipt to the retailer you purchased it from.

entry.title: Cancel Your Service
entry.content:
Cancel your service

If your phone isn’t recharged for a period of 6 months it will be deemed inactive and you will lose your number.

To cancel your service please message us (7am-11pm AEST, 7 days).

entry.title: Change Your Account Details
entry.content:
How do I change my account details?

To change your account details, please Message us or contact our Customer Care team on 125 8881.

entry.title: Boost Mobile Replacement SIM
entry.content:
How do I get a replacement SIM?

If you’ve lost your SIM or got a new phone and your SIM card doesn’t fit, don’t worry. We can organise a new SIM to be sent out to you ASAP.

All you need to do is call us on one of the numbers below and we’ll then send it out to you.

Boost Services: 125 8881 (When calling from a Boost/Telstra service)
New Customers: 1800 100 933 (When calling from a non-Boost/Telstra service)

We’ll also give you the option to suspend your service until the new SIM is received – just in case someone tries to use it. When you replace your SIM, you won’t lose your credit but credit expiry periods will still be applicable. If your credit is about to expire, you can  to retain the credit balance until you receive your replacement SIM card.

You also won’t lose your mobile number when you get your replacement SIM card.
